availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Nimrod E. Kay (Todd Co, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Married to Elizabeth M. Allensworth Kay in Todd County, Kentucky, on February 8, 1840. Farmer in Todd County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 283B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 2, p. 209.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Robertson County, 17th District, p. 215B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186, p. 148.
Find A Grave, "Nimrod E. Kay(Birth-Death)," Memorial #149594762, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149594762 (accessed October 16, 2019).
KYR-0004-033-0001.
